stream_context.summary: Kaze spent the session polishing several visual set-pieces instead of the planned Ooblack boss.  He and Biobak iterated on new star-select backdrops, implemented a bobbing submarine and spot-lights for the water course, and scripted a bird animation for the level-select screen.  Much of the stream revolved around troubleshooting vertex colours, N64 combiners and a mysterious sine-wave bug while discussing future level themes and an overworld redesign.

development_findings.summary: Current Ooblack boss is largely finished but still needs grill animations and additional coins; Kaze repeatedly postponed it for other tasks.
development_findings.quote: I think all that's missing right now for the boss fight is the grills animating.

development_findings.summary: Decision to add an animation where the Ooblack block spits Mario out after emerging.
development_findings.quote: Maybe after he comes out of here we just have an animation of him spitting out Mario and Mario lands over here.

development_findings.summary: Star-select backgrounds are being completely re-done by Biobak; each uses animated scenery (e.g., clouds, bird) plus course-specific lighting.
Kaze inserted a new low-poly submarine that bobs via sine-wave on both position and roll; he fixed erratic values caused by a missing math header that linked the wrong sine table in GCC.
development_findings.quote: How did it just link the sine table to a random thing instead of telling me that there's no sine table?

development_findings.summary: Water course runs ~60 FPS on real N64, giving headroom for added fishes, jellyfish and framebuffer effects (though the latter look low-res in emulators).
development_findings.quote: The level that the sub is in runs 60 FPS on N64 pretty much consistently. We can actually go sicko mode on that level.

development_findings.summary: Spot-lights were rebuilt with texture-based alpha plus vertex colours to avoid colour-banding and an ‘X’ artifact caused by vertex shading.
development_findings.quote: You can see the colour banding even here… I think we need to change the circles a little bit.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a multi-phase bird: idle hop, twitching tail, take-off on A-press; discovered object updates freeze during the fade-out, so animation must continue while the screen fades.
development_findings.quote: Everything just freezes when I press A.  I need to make it so that while the fade-out is happening, the animation is actually playing.

development_findings.summary: Global guideline: stars are placed 200 units above ground, boxes at 300.
Planned overworld redesign to a single tropical island inspired by Mario Party’s intro.
development_findings.quote: I was thinking we should theme the island for the overworld like this… tropical island. I think it’s a very cute design that works perfectly for our game.

development_findings.summary: Discussed remaining course themes: Wild-West ‘catch the evildoers’, Arctic ice-cream world with a train, comic-book skyscraper city; rejected music, casino, Sonic and ‘fanboy’ concepts.
Retro sections shortlist: Paper Mario 64 Goomba Town, Mario Paint, Dr Mario, Mario Land 1, Smash 64; still subject to change.
development_findings.quote: We looked at all of the retro games for a long time and we found nothing decent.

context_findings.summary: Kaze moves house tomorrow; will have a dedicated ‘dungeon’ office and may stream irregularly during a week off.
context_findings.quote: Next stream is not going to be here anymore because we are moving tomorrow… I’m going to have my own dungeon.

context_findings.summary: Excitement over latest YouTube video achieving double the usual views within hours.
context_findings.quote: This video got more views in like not even two hours than most videos get in a day.

context_findings.summary: Expressed frustration with GCC compiling the wrong sine table and with DK64’s gameplay.
context_findings.quote: DK64 is a very charming piece of shit… playing it is the worst thing ever.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy: prefers that players don’t notice the creator inside the game, in case of future ‘cancellation’.
context_findings.quote: The player shouldn’t even know that I exist… that way if I get cancelled on Twitter, no one has to put down the game.

context_findings.summary: Rejects using ‘femboy’ term due to sexual connotation; wants inclusivity without explicit sexuality.
context_findings.quote: I would not want him to be referred to as a femboy, because that seems like a sexual thing.

biobak.summary: Providing re-worked star-select graphics, submarine model, light textures and feedback on cloud and light motion.
biobak.quote: Okay, I think this is doing the thing that Biobak wants.

biobak.summary: Discussed desired sine-wave offsets (Y, Z) for submarine and wobble parameters for spot-lights.

zeina.summary: Zeina appeared briefly in chat; after the move she will stop streaming on mic and only join via chat.
zeina.quote: I won’t be on stream anymore. I will be in the chat from here on out.

key_stories.title: The Submarine Sine-Wave Bug
key_stories.summary: While animating the new submarine’s gentle bob, Kaze received impossible 16 000-unit offsets.  After long confusion he discovered GCC had linked an incorrect sine table because he hadn’t included the math header.
key_stories.challenge: Submarine y-position and roll produced garbage values, ruining animation.
key_stories.process: Verified vertex counts, checked combiners, printed sine inputs, finally realised math.h wasn’t included so compiler used garbage.
key_stories.outcome: Included math.h and rewrote with new sine function; submarine now bobs smoothly.
key_stories.key_quote: How did it just link the sine table to a random thing instead of telling me that there's no sine table?

key_stories.title: Spot-Light Colour-Banding Fix
key_stories.summary: Biobak’s dock lights showed harsh colour-banding and an ‘X’ artifact.  Kaze diagnosed vertex shading issues and rebuilt the lights with better alpha textures and duplicated geometry.
key_stories.challenge: Lights appeared banded and showed an unwanted ‘X’.
key_stories.process: Tested prim vs vertex colours, realised vertex normals caused shading, remodelled lights as separate quads using whiteness as alpha mask.
key_stories.outcome: Smooth, ominous lights without artifacts now frame the star-select screen.
key_stories.key_quote: You can see the colour banding even here… I think we need to change the circles a little bit.

key_stories.title: Bird Animation Freeze
key_stories.summary: A charming bird was added to the star-select backdrop, but pressing A froze its take-off.  Kaze traced the issue to the menu code halting object updates during fade-out.
key_stories.challenge: Animation stopped when player pressed A to select a star.
key_stories.process: Inserted idle and take-off animations, noticed objects froze, inspected update loop that stops after A-press.
key_stories.outcome: Temporary workaround by shortening fade; plans to let animation continue during fade in next session.
key_stories.key_quote: Everything just freezes when I press A… I need the objects to update while the fade-out is happening.
